intro: Actinophloeus microcarpus, commonly known as the small-fruited actinophloeus, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
